official-title.#text: To enhance the safety of ports of entry in the United States, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committees on
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#text: Ms. Eddie Bernice Johnson of Texas

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Putting Our Resources Toward Security (PORTS) Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Increase in number of Customs and Border Protection Officers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, subject to the availability of appropriations for such purpose, increase by not fewer than 5,000 the total number of full-time, active-duty Customs and Border Protection Officers within
for posting at United States ports of entry above the number of such officers for which funds were made available during fiscal year 2012.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Customs and Border Protection

text.#text: During the five-year period between fiscal years 2014 and 2018, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, subject to the availability of appropriations for purpose, increase by not fewer than 1,200 the number of full-time, active-duty Customs and Border Protection agriculture specialists for posting at United States ports of entry above the number of such support personnel for which funds were made available during fiscal year 2012.

text.#text: During the five-year period between fiscal years 2014 and 2018, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, subject to the availability of appropriations for such purpose, increase by not fewer than 350 the number of full-time, active-duty border security support personnel for posting at United States ports of entry above the number of such support personnel for which funds were made available during fiscal year 2012.

text.#text: During the five-year period between fiscal years 2014 and 2018, the

header.#text: Improving ports of entry for border security and other purposes

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the General Services Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#text: to make improvements to existing ports of entry in the United States to improve border security and for other purposes

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text: $1,000,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2014 through 2018

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: There are authorized to be appropriated to the
Administrator of the General Services Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall give priority to the ports of entry that the
determines are in most need of repair to improve border security and for other purposes in accordance with port of entry infrastructure assessment studies required in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 603 of title VI, division E, of the Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2008
